mdRecord.dcterms:title: Propinquity, detail view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: "John Mills established a trading post in 1790 in the steamboat town of Bayou Sara. In 1809 he decided to build a townhouse, and it was to the high ground of St. Francisville that he went to look for a homesite. He selected historic Royal Street and proceeded to build [his] home." --Louisiana Plantation Homes: A Return to Splendor by Lee Malone, p. 120 https://books.google.com/books?id=fT2aVkRihJ0C&pg=PA120&lpg=PA120&dq=propinquity+plantation&source=bl&ots=7w3kwTswV7&sig=XrchzjMtD_aPvyKOWe1iZXdc0uM&hl=en&sa=X&ei=HL-qVNj-KY2GyATgmoGgAw&ved=0CB4Q6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=propinquity%20plantation&f=false [work]
